newsitem.title: GREECE: EUROPARTENARIAT GLOBAL BUSINESSMEN MEET IN ATHENS.
newsitem.headline: EUROPARTENARIAT GLOBAL BUSINESSMEN MEET IN ATHENS.

text.p: International businessmen met in Athens on Thursday to prepare for a June 23-24 Europartenariat conference that is expected to attract more than 2,400 participants.
This year's Europartenariat in the port city of Piraeus will focus on new entrepreneurs said Christos Papoutsis, the European Commissioner for Tourism, in an statement addressed to the meeting.
"Europartenariat will focus on the new generation of entrepreneurs and the problems they face," Papoutsis said.
The conference, sponsored by the European Commission and Greece's National Economy ministry, will seek to bring together businesses from over 70 countries.
More than 200,000 international firms have forged bussiness deals since 1988 when Europartenariat was established, organisers said.
